title: Fighter Rework: Remove Critical Strike Chance on Ranged Champions
body:
The main problem with Fighters is they share or can share alot of the items ADCs use. It is really hard if not impossible to make items that benefit Fighters but ADC's cant (ab)use better or vice-versa. 

I have an idea, but it is quite radical and requires a complete item and maybe even kit/balance overhaul. However I think it has alot of benefits.

**Remove Critical Strike Chance for Ranged Attacks.**

* Gives Melee fighters a distinct characteristic: If they get close they have a chance to deal extra damage (with less AD investment + high risk/reward).
* Emphasises Ranged Marksmen's characteristic of dealing sustained, constant and reliable damage. (opposed to RNG/Bursty).
* Removes alot of the problems with crossover itemization and abuse cases.

This will allow fighters to make item choices balancing damage (prioritising ARpen + Crit chance) with tank + chase items so they can get to melee range, deal their damage, apply their CC and ARpen.

Rather than focusing how Fighters get close and stick to a target (  ),
I would focus on how they get rewarded for getting close and how it compares to champions that dont need to get close (ie: ADC's).

Fighters would be able to get a crit item for their (RNG) damage, get some tank + sticky items and Armor shred. In turn Armor shred should be more expensive for ADC's, thus requiring Fighters in the late game to provide Armor shred and peel power for the ADC's while not making their damage obsolete. In return ADC's should get better scaling due to the removal of Crit chance.

With {{champion:157}}  and the {{champion:22}} rework, you can already see Riot testing this direction.

replies.body:
We're on the same page when it comes to fighters and ADC item overlap, which makes it difficult to offer effects that are an appropriate fit for one class, but not the other. Removing ranged crit's not the solution we're trying out however, we feel that does add some important value to the ADC role. What we're looking into instead for fighters are items that:

* Are a combination of offensive/defensive effects and therefore generally of noticeably lower appeal to ADCs who want to go full offense (e.g. the revised Black Cleaver which has a significant part of its budget spent on health, something fighters are fine with, but ADCs often aren't).
* Offer additional rewards when combined with other defensive/partially defensive items (Atma's Impaler back in the day was an example of this sort of effect. It did have some other issues and so we felt we had to remove it, we believe there may be some variants on the concept that work better however).
* Help melee champions engage in a fight, or stick to targets better once in a fight, in ways that aren't as consistently useful or accessible on ranged champions (Randuin's and Phage are good examples of this category) .

We're currently working on some items using the above approaches, which are intended in part to be good fits on heavy, immobile fighters like Garen, Darius, Udyr etc. More details to follow sometime pretty soon (patch 5.16 or 5.17 at a guess, so potentially hitting PBE 1-3 weeks from now, depending on how the rest of the work goes).

Does this new itemization apply only on AD based fighters or also on AP based fighters?

I know there has already been a revision of AP items but more focused over mages rather than AP fighters (such as Mordekaiser)
This is AD focused work, we feel AP itemization's in a generally good spot for now after the 5.13 changes.
Including Essence Reaver, right?
Essence Reaver we'll look at when we work on ADC itemization.

Why not look at it with fighter itemization? ADCs simply don't want it unless they are Ezreal, but mana-hungry bruisers and physical damage nukers like Pantheon, Urgot, and Jayce would die for an Essence Reaver that is more tailored to their needs - perhaps one with a much lower price point and mana-regen in the buildpath.

This is a good point.  ADCs specifically don't want it so much but I think champs that use a good mix of AA and spells do.  

IMO it's great on someone like Poppy and Vi for the CDR/mana, but they can't always get it.

I think I'd rather replace the Vampiric Scepter with Brutalizer and give ER ArPen instead of lifesteal. Honestly, ER can't compete with {{item:3072}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3074}} when you want LS, so why should it try?

No, I think it needs the lifesteal/mana steal components, its main problem is the build order.  You don't get the mana until a little later than you want it.  I wouldn't complain if the life steal was bumped up to 12% or 15% though.

ER having lifesteal was a terrible mistake. The space it needs to occupy isn't a general sustain item, but an alternative to IE aimed at caster-carries and AD Mages - boosting sustained physical damage from spells via mana regen and AD

I'd imagine IE looking something like this;

pickaxe + forbidden idol + longsword + x gold = ER (total cost around 2600)

40 AD
x mana regen
10% CDR
passive; dealing physical damage from a basic attack or single target spell gives mana and deals bonus damage equal to the mana restored

Other than late game scaling (which could be achieved in a different way once you remove ranged crit chance) I dont see what crit chance offers. 

> * Are a combination of offensive/defensive effects and therefore generally of noticeably lower appeal to ADCs who want to go full offense (e.g. the revised Black Cleaver which has a significant part of its budget spent on health, something fighters are fine with, but ADCs often aren't).

no argument there, I like the BC direction.

> * Offer additional rewards when combined with other defensive/partially defensive items (Atma's Impaler back in the day was an example of this sort of effect. It did have some other issues and so we felt we had to remove it, we believe there may be some variants on the concept that work better however).

Yes, I also like that direction and what if one of those effects could be melee-only critical strike chance? 

It also makes sense from a thematical point of view: A fighter that's up close will really be able to hit those tender spots, whereas those spots can be protected from ranged attacks. This would further emphasize (for example) Caitlyns (unique) ability to critically strike from ranged with her passive because she excells at sniping/high precision shots.

I could really see Jax's crit animation swinging upwards between the legs... you know, uhh... hitting those "tender spots". :)

> * Help melee champions engage in a fight, or stick to targets better once in a fight, in ways that aren't as consistently useful or accessible on ranged champions (Randuin's and Phage are good examples of this category) .
> 

See this is mainly what I am concerned about: many fighters already have some ways of getting close to a target and then staying there. By giving these champions too many options in the sticky department you risk making them very frustrating and overbearing. 

What I think would happen with crit being exclusive to melee is rather than strengthening/emphasizing their sticking potential is rewarding them with damage from crit chance for succeeding in getting to/sticking to a target. There's a high risk involved in getting to melee range and it would only be appropriate there's a high reward. 

While ranged auto attack damage should not be subject to RNG/burst effects rather be constant with a predictable scaling.

> We're currently working on some items using the above approaches, which are intended in part to be good fits on heavy, immobile fighters like Garen, Darius, Udyr etc. More details to follow sometime pretty soon (patch 5.16 or 5.17 at a guess, so potentially hitting PBE 1-3 weeks from now, depending on how the rest of the work goes).

I really think removing critical chance from ranged attacks will truly open up the playing field, right now it narrows the playing field for both ADC's and fighters. **I really think it's something you should just consider and play around with**, if only for the change in perspective, maybe you'll drop the idea itself but other interesting ideas might pop up.

thanks for the interesting reply.

There are not that many levers to balance ranged adcs left, if you cannot add pure power to the champion.

Well you could just make crit into what Ashe passive pretty much is
In general 1% crit gives 1% increased damage IF you crit the average amount of times (which would be 1 crit for every 100 hits)
However instead of having 99 attacks dealing 100% damage and one attack dealing 200% damage
With the way Ashe crit works you instead get 100 attacks which deal 101% damage

(and IE just increases it by 50%.... 1% crit --> 1.5% increased damage)

That way you remove the RNG at least

I have to agree with Fluppets here. 90% of ADCs share similar builds. The exceptions: Ezreal, Miss Fortune, Kalista, Vayne are actually some of my favorite ADCs because of their ability to build differently and still do well. 
While I do think critical chance should be a rewarding way to build a marksman, it should not allow a marksman to outburst a mage or an assassin. This is one of the biggest problems playing assassins right now. Late game, if an assassin fails to reach the ADC or if a mage misses so much as a single ability, they pretty much lose that fight. There's no recovery, and screwing up is extremely brutal and unforgiving. A fight should not be about who hits first, it should be about who is more skilled at kiting and utilizing their kit to their advantage. Granted, by all means let that ADC take advantage of their range when an enemy screws up... but don't give them kill potential within 3-4 auto attacks. That's not alright. What has this lead to? Marksman who do build differently due to their kit having an extremely hard time keeping up in damage, and likewise, making it hard to succeed in lane. In addition to this, it has also pretty much set in stone a build path if you want to be guaranteed good, solid damage. In conclusion, it leaves the role feeling dry and repetitive. While kit certainly does play a huge amount into gameplay, most ADCs have some kind of dash, and an attack speed / damage steroid. This is why things like Kalista's Rend and Miss Fortune's scaling make them fun to play. They change up gameplay, and you can build them differently, and still do well.
thats not much of a problem for more assassin's since champions like zed talon and kat hardly give adcs enough time to react but ever since riot found that oppressing they were nerfed

>Removing ranged crit's not the solution we're trying out however, we feel that does add some important value to the ADC role.

though this is exactly the main problem melees face later on - they get bursted down within the 1-2sec they need to close the gap in the lategame, by a class that is supposed to deal dmg over time, not excel at burst.
THe only Value Crit adds to this game is that it makes Luck more valuable than skill, at least in it´s current iteration.

Then how do you suggest ADC's ever be useful against a full tank build when they have a small window to stop them? This is not in regards to teamfights, but say 2v2's or situations where you can't peel for the ADC. You already can get into an ADC's face and just destroy them if you're tanky enough. Not many have escape tools and usually the enemy roster is already gunning for them. Idk. 

I agree with the thought that crit is a weird stat to balance though. Perhaps if ADC's had more options regarding escaping then I'd feel more comfortable with changing crit. But as it stands, it's so difficult to deal with bruisers that can just gap close onto you and destroy you--even when they don't build damage.

Edit: This severely limits the kind of ADC that you can viably play and remain effective, I guess. Fighters are already in a really good spot right now and can be effective especially coming off of tank meta and the numerous buffs champs like shyvana and trundle have received. I am really not in favor of making it even more difficult to play marksmen classes.

ive had an idea for a fighter item for a while.

what about adding a wicket hatchet item to summoners rift? preferably in combination with armor to fill the void that atmas left. something along the lines of

{{item:3122}} + {{item:1037}}  + {{item:1031}} 

why hatchet in particular? because the way the passive works, it is already used to full effect even with a lower critical strike chance. a critical strike about every 3 seconds is enough to reapply the passive throughout a fight.

meaning fighters who usually build less crit chance with  {{item:3078}} or {{item:3142}}  would already use the passive to full effect, while ranged adc who usually build a higher total amount of crit wouldnt get more out of it.

the only change that would have to be amde is that the passive on the upgraded item from hatchet doesnt scale with bonus ad, but has a level scaling passive like sunfire cape instead, or maybe even scales with bonus health.

i know, that im kindof biased in that case because im missing the stat combination of ad, armor and critical strike chance on garen that atmas provided. but imo this item would also benefit any triforce bruiser just as much, to ge a little bit more worth out of those 10% crit chance on the item.


another possibility would be an item, that creates a diminishing return effect to crowd control. a fighter item with a passive that starts at 10 tenacity and then gains 10 tenacity for each movement impairing effect, that hits the champion. stacking up to a rather high value of something around 70 or 80 tenacity total. after a few seconds, of not being hit by any new movement impairing effects, this buff would fall off again.

this would help fighters to deal with champions like anivia in a game, who alone could completely invalidate certain champions by basically constantly ccing them. (she throws down the ult, and champs like udyr, darius, garen, olaf when not ulting, cant move anymore).



as for how to create fighter specific items, its not that much of a problem. you already did it successfully with hydra, by sticking a melee only label on it. so this method was already successful. i dont really understand, why you guys arent building up on that.

> - Offer additional rewards when combined with other defensive/partially defensive items (Atma's Impaler back in the day was an example of this sort of effect. It did have some other issues and so we felt we had to remove it, we believe there may be some variants on the concept that work better however).

I feel like one of the core reasons for the abuse of Atma's Impaler in the infamous Atmog's/Fratma's lay in the fact that the passive effect was essentially uncapped and thus could result in pretty absurd AD values.
Could it be possible to circumvent said abuse cases by capping such a a conversion at a point that is reachable with some extra HP (like, a 1.5% HP to AD conversion that is capped at 30 AD, reaching said value with 2000 HP). So the players could either decide to buy the converting item late in the game or early after a big HP buy...
This would essentially allow you to assign a definite gold value to the passive conversion and balance around said gold value.

You do know that even at the uncapped 1.5% HP --> AD was almost unused so why would people bother with it if it is capped?

Also the reason Atmog's/Fratma's was so good was also because it was a health meta where tanks and bruiser stacked health since it was more efficient then resistances (and it was 2% HP --> AD at the time)

Also Atma's was a pretty good mid game item as it gave armor (against other bruisers) and some crit which could be good and decent AD (because of your base HP and it also scaled as you build other HP items or leveled up) and it was pretty cheap and affordable

It would likely be much more balanced if it was based off of bonus HP which would push the champions buying to to actually buy HP items and such to make the most out of (Old Atma's at 2% HP to AD was pretty good even if you built NO hp at all)

Of course I do know that. I was there the whole time.

In a vacuum, yes, a capped conversion is weaker than an uncapped one. However, and this would be the big aspect:
Capping it at a reachable value for everyone would allow for putting a price tag on the stats - the maximum value someone could get out of the item. With that, it allows tuning the item for a specific purpose: To be either a late-game purchase without additional health or to be something you'd ideally buy on top of already having some extra HP.
Essentially, it would keep an item which base concept is rather strong (AD/Armor combination) from being abused in a lane scenario, by putting the point of maximum power farther back.

Well there is already a cap not like you can get infinite HP(Unless you are Sion) and you likely do want and need to build some resistances to make better use of all of that HP
And if you had the HP to AD ratio stay at 1.5% and you cap it at 30 AD... a lot of champions would pretty much cap it without building any HP
As base HP at level 18 ranges from 1645 to 2347 and it would cap at 2000 hp (so basically it's kind of an item which scales with level? which you can speed up by buying HP of course the cap stays the same)

I personally see little to no itemization overlap with fighters and ADC's. I think something to keep in mind when thinking about itemization ideas for AD fighters is that there is a great level of disparity between AD and AP itemization. Itemization choices for AP fighters is far superior than what is currently available to AD fighters. AD fighters typically have to dedicate a certain number of slots to offensive stats and the remainder is left to defensive items, AP fighters however don't really face this same kind of dilemma as they can easily pick up every defensive stat needed and have 4-5 items that provide ability power. AP champs simply have easier access to defensive stats. There has been mention of Atma's on here, which is an item that if reintroduced would be able to put fighters in a better place, perhaps removing the crit chance and replacing it with 20 flat pen would have a significant impact.
